intro: Pseudolysimachion miyabei, commonly known as the Japanese spurge, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Pseudolysimachion miyabei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
